markdownRemark.html:
After my OnePlus 3 smashed into the ground – for the third time, I decided it was time for an upgrade. I was waiting for the release of the Pixel 3, but was a bit disappointed by that notch, and most of all, the price.

Now… I'm a big fan of pure, clean Android ROMs, and even though MIUI 10 was not as bad as I expected, the trying-to-be-iOS thing really doesn't suit Android, so I deviced to install a custom ROM based on Pixel's one. Here's the steps for installing Pixel Experience ROM on your Mi Mix 2S:

⚠️ It goes without saying that I'm not responsible for bricking your device. So proceed at your own risk.

1. Unlocking the Bootloader

  1. Enable Developer Tools by going to Settings › About Phone, and tapping on MIUI Version for about 7-10 times. You should see a message saying “You are now a developer”.
  2. Enable OEM unlocking option by going to Settings › Additional Settings › Developer Tools.
  3. Download the Mi Unlock tool and sign in to your [Mi Account].(https://global.account.xiaomi.com/pass/register)
  4. Shut down your phone, and hold volume down and power button to enter Fastboot Mode.
  5. Connect your phone to your PC using a USB cable and click “Unlock”. If you just got the phone, you might need to wait for 72h after the account was created.

2. Installing the custom ROM

Now that you have your bootloader unlocked, you're free to do whatever you want with your device. Head over to XDA and follow the steps to install your Pixel Experience ROM.

3. Installing Google’s Camera App

The best thing about the Pixel is the camera, and surprisingly what really makes the camera shine is the software, not the hardware. Some developers have taken Google's Camera software and ported to different devices. After lots of tests, I found out that the ones developed by BSG perform great with the Pixel Experience ROM, specially the MGC_6.1.021_MI8_Vc.apk.

Seriously, the image quality is at least 50% better than the pre-installed camera app. Portrait mode works great!

Hope you enjoy this crude guide, I'm mostly posting here so if I need to do any of these again I have guide to follow.

frontmatter.title: Xiaomi Mi Mix 2S: the Pixel without the notch
